name: GenAI Genesis 2025
description: Built intelligent meeting assistant with real-time transcription, summarization, and task extraction. Integrated LLMs for contextual understanding and automated action item prioritization.
problemStatement: Meeting participants waste hours transcribing notes and extracting action items manually. Critical decisions and tasks get lost in lengthy discussions.
approach: Developed a real-time AI assistant that captures meeting audio, transcribes with Whisper API, summarizes key points using GPT-4, and automatically extracts actionable tasks with priority ranking.
impact: Reduced post-meeting work by 60%, improved action item tracking by 85%, and enabled instant meeting summaries for absent stakeholders.
challenges: Handling multiple speakers, maintaining context across long meetings, and ensuring accurate task extraction with proper assignees.

name: Telus Data for Good 2024
description: Developed analytics platform to identify underserved communities and optimize healthcare resource allocation. Used demographic data, health metrics, and geospatial analysis.
impact: Identified 15+ underserved neighborhoods for mobile clinic deployment
problemStatement: Healthcare resources are often distributed inefficiently, leaving vulnerable communities underserved while others have excess capacity.
approach: Built a data analytics platform combining demographic census data, health outcome metrics, and geospatial analysis to identify healthcare deserts and recommend optimal resource allocation strategies.
challenges: Integrating disparate data sources, handling missing data in underserved areas, and creating actionable recommendations that account for real-world constraints like budget and staffing.

name: Binghamton University and ISTE 2023
description: Created hybrid deep learning model combining Graph Neural Networks and LSTM for stock price forecasting. Captured inter-stock relationships and temporal patterns simultaneously.
impact: 18% improvement in prediction accuracy over baseline models
problemStatement: Traditional stock prediction models treat stocks in isolation, missing critical inter-stock relationships and sector-wide trends that drive market movements.
approach: Developed a hybrid architecture using Graph Neural Networks to model stock relationships (industry sectors, supply chains) and LSTM networks to capture temporal price patterns. The model jointly learns spatial and temporal dependencies.
challenges: Defining meaningful graph structures between stocks, handling the computational complexity of GNN+LSTM architecture, and avoiding overfitting on historical patterns.
